body.name: Is It Wrong to Try to Pick Up Girls in a Dungeon?, Vol. 18 (light novel) (Is It Wrong to Try to Pick Up Girls in a Dungeon? Memoria Freese)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Conclusio to this arc
reviews.reviewText: Probably the best volume to date. And no I'm not exaggerating.I waited two years to read this volume and it was stellar. Took me a few days to read because its so long, but the author its a masterful story teller and paints the scenes with detail and clarity.We see the Freya familia and Hestia familia faceoff in a war game after freya's attemp to steal Bell and charm Orario. Prepare for 400 pages of nonstop action!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2024
reviews.reviewText: As a fan of this series, this installment may just be the best book in the series to date. If not, then definitely top 5.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Now this was a war game!
reviews.reviewText: Everyone played a role in this war game. The story was layered amazing.So many tie-ins from previous events. I enjoyed my reading of this story, thank you Fujino Omori!The story inches ever closer to the secrets hidden!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I really enjoyed this book.
reviews.reviewText: I really enjoyed this book. I didn't like the end. I will keep getting them though because they are really good.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Lovely read, love the entire series, I'm always waiting for new volumes! Ryuu Best gorl

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Won't let go of it
reviews.reviewText: This volume(18) compared to other volumes like (14), has alot of action and perfectly ends the arc with having the reader want more.The war game itself imo was a bit underwhelming especially with what's at stake. Now just hoping that next volumes will have them back into the dungeon picking up damsels in distress as usual.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Excessive Use of Plot Armor
reviews.reviewText: This book takes plot armor to the extreme and is a perfect example of Stan Lee's statement of: "The person that would win in a fight is the person the script writer wants to win." Normally, I don't care much about power level arguments or whatever as long it is in the realm of plausibility, but the author stretched his own system to an extreme in this book to make it unbelievable. To make things more ridiculous is that he had everyone sit on the side (Loki familia) with flimsy logic who could have alleviated the problem. Instead, he showed biased favoritism towards other characters he wanted to fight by having the Freya supporters conveniently "forget" to ban outside familia members from joining the war game later. Sure, maybe having Loki familia members fight would have taken some focus away from Hestia familia, but at least the book would have been believable and enjoyable.I hope this pattern doesn't continue in future books as I have really enjoyed the series up to this volume, but this book sure did kill my excitement and anticipation for future books. Overall, the writing and execution of this volume left much to desire.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewText: So many times the author gave characters new skills they never had before. Some make sense due to level ups others make no sense because we are well aware of their skill sets.This book is 100% combat with 90% ridiculousness.
Llegó en buen estado y antes de la fecha prevista, la historia de danmachi me gusta, ojalá y estuvieran también en español.

reviews.reviewTitle: Epica fine del ciclo di Syr
reviews.reviewText: Sono servite il doppio delle pagine per portare a termine lo scontro epico nelle seconda guerra fra famiglie.Tralasciando l'esito scontato - Bell non può soccombere - , ho divorato il libro. Il climax è sempre stato carico di tensione (con colpi più o meno a sorpresa).Forse qualche trovata un po' troppo buonista e strampalata, ma fa parte della città creata dall'autore.In attesa del prossimo arco narrativo per vedere se ci saranno nuovi sviluppi sui punti rimasti un po' in ombra (Ainz, Xenos, il dungeon, il drago)
